title: Foundation: Bachelor's Degree and Teaching Qualification
description: The most common path to school administration is through teaching. Obtain a Bachelor's degree (B.Ed., BA, or BSc) and a teaching qualification like a Postgraduate Diploma in Education (PGDE).

title: Gain Extensive Teaching Experience
description: Work as a teacher in a school for a significant period. This is essential for understanding school culture, student needs, teacher challenges, and the curriculum. Leadership potential is often identified during this stage.
qualifications: Proven track record as an effective teacher

title: Master's in Educational Administration & Leadership
description: Pursue a postgraduate degree focused on school management. This provides the theoretical framework for financial management, school law, human resource management, and strategic planning in an educational context.
qualifications: Master of Education (M.Ed.) in Educational Leadership/Administration

title: Mid-Level Administrative Roles
description: Take on roles with administrative responsibility, such as Sectional Head, Head of Department, or Vice Principal. This is the training ground for senior leadership, where you manage teams of teachers, oversee academic programs, and handle disciplinary matters.
qualifications: For government schools, passing the Sri Lanka Principal Service (SLPS) exam is necessary
institutes: N/A - Promotion within the school system

title: Principal / Head of School
description: Advance to the top leadership position. As a Principal, you are the chief executive of the school, responsible for its overall academic success, financial health, staff management, and strategic direction.
qualifications: SLPS Grade I (for top government schools)
institutes: N/A - Appointed based on service and qualifications
